Kuzniar, Toronto, U of Toronto P, 2017, x + 223 pp., 4 illustrations. Literature and the Cult of Personality: Essays on Goethe and His Influence, by Gregory Maertz, Stuttgart, ibidem, 2017, x + 278 pp. E.T.A. Hoffmann’s Orient: Romantic Aesthetics and the German Imagination, by Joanna Neilly, Cambridge, Legenda, 2016, xii + 157 pp.

item.title: Schillers Geschichtsdenken: Die Unbegreiflichkeit der Weltgeschichte by Alexander Jakovljević (review)
item.description: In lieu of an abstract, here is a brief excerpt of the content: Reviewed by Asko Nivala Alexander Jakovljević. Schillers Geschichtsdenken: Die Unbegreiflichkeit der Weltgeschichte. Berlin: Ripperger & Kremers Verlag, 2015. 381 pp. Among the many contributions of Immanuel Kant’s Critique of Judgment (1790) was to question the dogmatic belief in providence: Kant argued that the human mind represents both organic nature and human history as if (als ob) both were teleological, although we can never verify this claim.

item.title: Book Review of Romanticism, Humanism, Judaism / Romantik, Humanismus, Judentum
